description.raw:
By default, cheats (aka "development aids") are now disabled.  This is done by not advertising and not subscribing to the ROS topics associated with the cheats.

Cheats can be enabled by setting the environment variable `VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED` to `1`.  E.g., at the command-line:

    VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED=1 roslaunch atlas_utils atlas.launch

Or in a launch file:

    <launch>
      <env name="VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED" value="1"/>
      <include file="$(find atlas_utils)/launch/atlas.launch"/>
    </launch>

ROS API tests are included for both cheats enabled and cheats disabled for all supported launch files.
description.html:
By default, cheats (aka "development aids") are now disabled. This is done by not advertising and not subscribing to the ROS topics associated with the cheats.

Cheats can be enabled by setting the environment variable VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED to 1. E.g., at the command-line:

VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED=1 roslaunch atlas_utils atlas.launch

Or in a launch file:

<launch>
  <env name="VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED" value="1"/>
  <include file="$(find atlas_utils)/launch/atlas.launch"/>
</launch>

ROS API tests are included for both cheats enabled and cheats disabled for all supported launch files.

title.html: Remove cheats (issue #195)
